author: Malkeet Singh
title: Can we use genrec sort function for list having duplicate values
question:
Hello,
I was trying to use the genrec sort function for a list having duplicate values. The function produced (list 1 2) for (qsort (list 1 1 2)), and I can understand that this is because of the definition of <p? and >p? functions. (< or > x PIVOT)
Then, I tried using (define (<p? x) (< = x PIVOT)) as well,  but it made racket going out of memory.
So, my question is: Is it possible to use (qsort (list 1 1 2)), and get (list 1 1 2) as answer.
instructor_answer: Why do you think your DrRacket ran forever?  What did the change you made do to the termination argument?
